intro: Sprengelia incarnata var. brevistylis, commonly known as the dwarf-styled spider orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories where it can receive indirect sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces showy, fragrant blooms during the warmer months. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
